title: Tribe completes trade with Phillies
subtitle: Indians complete trade with Phillies
body: CLEVELAND -- The first domino in the Coco Crisp-to-Boston trade saga has officially fallen.  The Indians completed a trade Friday night that sent left-handed setup man Arthur Rhodes to the Phillies for outfielder Jason Michaels.  The deal is expected to spur a second trade in which the Indians would send Crisp, right-hander David Riske and backup catcher Josh Bard to the Red Sox for right-handed reliever Guillermo Mota, third base prospect Andy Marte, catching prospect Kelly Shoppach, a player to be named later and cash. Anthony Castrovince is a reporter for MLB.com. This story was not subject to the approval of Major League Baseball or its clubs.
author: Anthony Castrovince
